p:
According to the third round of WHO's 2015 Global Health Estimates (GHE),
1 liver diseases caused 1 312 480 (4·6%) of 28 444 814 deaths in the Asia-Pacific region in 2015, compared with 72 437 (2·7%) of 2 649 742 in the USA and 197 179 (2·1%) of 9 278 557 in Europe. The Asia-Pacific region accounts for 62·6% of 2 095 207 deaths due to liver diseases globally for that year. In Asian countries, the median proportion of deaths attributable to liver disease was 3·9% (range 1·86–13·9). By contrast, liver diseases caused 2·05% of all deaths in Australia and 1·33% of those in New Zealand in 2015 ( figure 1 ), with underlying aetiologies varying between countries ( figure 2 ).
1
